info.name: QShelter API
info.description:
Complete API collection for QShelter Real Estate Platform.

## Services
- **User Service**: Authentication, users, roles, tenants, API keys
- **Property Service**: Properties, amenities, media
- **Mortgage Service**: Payment plans, payment methods, applications, phases, payments
- **Documents Service**: Document upload and management

## Authentication
All requests require the following headers:
- `x-tenant-id`: Your tenant ID
- `x-user-id`: The authenticated user ID

## Base URLs
Set the service URL variables to your environment:
- LocalStack Mortgage: `http://localhost:4566/restapis/{apiId}/localstack/_user_request_`
- LocalStack User: `http://localhost:4566/restapis/{apiId}/localstack/_user_request_`
- LocalStack Property: `http://localhost:4566/restapis/{apiId}/localstack/_user_request_`

variable.description: User ID for tenant membership operations
Target tenant ID for switching tenants
Role ID for tenant membership operations
New role ID for updating member roles

item.name: Event Handlers
item.description: Event handlers define actions to trigger when workflow events occur (e.g., send email when phase completes). Handlers are attached to phase or step templates.

request.description:
Create an event handler.

**Handler Types:**
- `SEND_EMAIL` - Send email notification
- `SEND_SMS` - Send SMS
- `SEND_PUSH` - Send push notification
- `CALL_WEBHOOK` - Call external API
- `ADVANCE_WORKFLOW` - Advance workflow step
- `RUN_AUTOMATION` - Execute internal logic
Toggle the enabled/disabled status of an event handler.

item.name: Payment Plans
item.description: Payment plans define the installment structure for phases (frequency, number of installments, interest calculation).

request.description:
Create a new payment plan template.

**Payment Frequency Options:**
- `MONTHLY`
- `BIWEEKLY`
- `WEEKLY`
- `ONE_TIME`
- `CUSTOM`

item.name: Payment Methods
item.description: Payment methods are templates that define the entire application workflow including phases, steps, and document requirements.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "10/90 Mortgage",
  "description": "10% downpayment, 90% mortgage",
  "isActive": true,
  "allowEarlyPayoff": true,
  "autoActivatePhases": true,
  "phases": [
    {
      "name": "KYC & Documentation",
      "phaseCategory": "DOCUMENTATION",
      "phaseType": "KYC",
      "order": 1,
      "stepDefinitions": [
        {"name": "Upload ID", "stepType": "UPLOAD", "order": 1, "requiredDocumentTypes": ["ID_CARD"]},
        {"name": "Upload Proof of Income", "stepType": "UPLOAD", "order": 2, "requiredDocumentTypes": ["PAYSLIP"]},
        {"name": "Admin Review", "stepType": "REVIEW", "order": 3}
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "Downpayment",
      "phaseCategory": "PAYMENT",
      "phaseType": "DOWNPAYMENT",
      "order": 2,
      "percentOfPrice": 10,
      "paymentPlanId": "{{downpaymentPlanId}}",
      "collectFunds": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Mortgage",
      "phaseCategory": "PAYMENT",
      "phaseType": "MORTGAGE",
      "order": 3,
      "percentOfPrice": 90,
      "interestRate": 9.5,
      "paymentPlanId": "{{mortgagePlanId}}",
      "collectFunds": false
    }
  ]
}

request.description:
Create a complete payment method template with phases.

**Phase Categories:**
- `DOCUMENTATION` - For KYC, document uploads, reviews
- `PAYMENT` - For collecting payments

**Phase Types:**
- `KYC` - Know Your Customer
- `VERIFICATION` - Document verification
- `DOWNPAYMENT` - Initial payment
- `MORTGAGE` - Long-term financing
- `BALLOON` - Balloon payment
- `CUSTOM`

**Step Types:**
- `UPLOAD` - User uploads document
- `REVIEW` - Admin reviews documents
- `SIGNATURE` - Requires signature
- `APPROVAL` - Requires approval
- `GENERATE_DOCUMENT` - Auto-generate offer letter
Link a payment method to a property. This makes the payment method available for applications on that property.
Get all payment methods available for a specific property.

Attach an event handler to a phase template.

**Phase Triggers:**
- `ON_ACTIVATE` - Phase becomes current
- `ON_COMPLETE` - Phase completed
- `ON_CANCEL` - Phase cancelled
- `ON_PAYMENT_RECEIVED` - Payment received (PAYMENT phases)
- `ON_ALL_PAYMENTS_RECEIVED` - All payments complete
Get all event attachments for a phase template.

Attach an event handler to a step template.

**Step Triggers:**
- `ON_COMPLETE` - Step completed
- `ON_REJECT` - Step rejected
- `ON_SUBMIT` - Step submitted for review
- `ON_RESUBMIT` - Step resubmitted after rejection
- `ON_START` - Step started
Get all event attachments for a step template.

item.name: Applications
item.description: Applications are instantiated from payment methods and track the buyer's journey through phases.

body.raw:
{
  "propertyUnitId": "{{propertyUnitId}}",
  "paymentMethodId": "{{paymentMethodId}}",
  "title": "Purchase Agreement - Unit A1",
  "description": "Application for Lekki Gardens Unit A1",
  "applicationType": "MORTGAGE",
  "totalAmount": 10000000
}

request.description: Create a new application from a payment method. This instantiates all phases and steps from the payment method template.

query.description: Filter by status: DRAFT, PENDING, ACTIVE, COMPLETED, CANCELLED, TERMINATED

request.description: Get the current action required for this application. This is the canonical endpoint for the app to know what to show the user.

Trigger a state transition on the application.

**Common triggers:**
- `SUBMIT` - Submit draft for review
- `APPROVE` - Approve application
- `ACTIVATE` - Activate application
Sign the application. This activates the application if all requirements are met.
Delete a application. Only works for DRAFT applications.

item.name: Application Phases
item.description: Phases are the stages of a application (KYC, Downpayment, Mortgage, etc.)

request.description: Generate installment schedule for a payment phase.

Complete a step in a documentation phase.

**Decision options:**
- `APPROVED` - Step approved
- `REJECTED` - Step rejected
- `REQUEST_CHANGES` - Request changes from user
Upload a document for a phase. The URL should be a pre-signed S3 URL where the document was uploaded.

Review a document.

**Status options:**
- `APPROVED`
- `REJECTED`

item.name: Application Payments
item.description: Payment operations for applications.

request.description:
Create a new payment record.

**Payment Methods:**
- `BANK_TRANSFER`
- `CREDIT_CARD`
- `WALLET`
- `CASH`
- `CHECK`

Process a payment callback from the payment gateway.

**Status options:**
- `COMPLETED`
- `FAILED`
Make an advance payment to be applied to future installments.

item.name: Property Transfer
item.description: Transfer a application to a different property.

request.description: Request to transfer a application to a different property unit.

Approve a transfer request.

**Price Adjustment Handling Options:**
- `ADD_TO_MORTGAGE` - Add difference to mortgage
- `REQUIRE_PAYMENT` - Require immediate payment
- `CREDIT_BUYER` - Credit buyer for difference

item.name: Payment Method Change
item.description: Request to change the payment method of an existing application.

request.description: Mark documents as submitted, moving the request to the review queue.
Execute an approved change request. This performs the actual application modification.

item.name: User Service
item.description: User management, authentication, roles, and tenants.

item.name: Authentication
item.description: Login, signup, and token management.

request.description: Register a new user account.
Login with email and password. Returns access and refresh tokens.
Exchange a refresh token for a new access token.
Verify email address using token from email.
Request a password reset email.
Reset password using token from email.
Login using a Google ID token (from mobile/web client).
Get the currently authenticated user's profile.

item.name: Users
item.description: User CRUD operations and management.

request.description: List all users with pagination and filtering.
Get a single user by ID.
Update user information.
Update the authenticated user's profile.
Update user's avatar URL.
Suspend a user account.
Reinstate a suspended user account.
Assign roles to a user.
Delete a user.

item.name: Roles
item.description: Role management.

request.description: List all roles.
Create a new role.
Get a role by ID.
Update a role.
Delete a role.

item.name: Tenants
item.description: Tenant (organization) management.

request.description: List all tenants.
Create a new tenant.
Get a tenant by ID.
Get a tenant by subdomain.
Update a tenant.
Delete a tenant.

item.name: API Keys
item.description: API key management for partner integrations.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "CRM Integration",
  "description": "Used by Salesforce to sync property data",
  "provider": "salesforce",
  "scopes": ["property:read", "mortgage:read"],
  "expiresAt": "2027-12-31T23:59:59.000Z"
}

request.description: Create a new API key for partner integration. Returns the credential (shown only once).
List all API keys for the tenant.
Get a single API key by ID.
Enable or disable an API key temporarily.
Permanently revoke an API key.
Exchange an API key credential for a short-lived JWT token. This is the public endpoint for partners.

item.name: Social Profiles
item.description: Social login profile management.

request.description: Get all social profiles linked to a user.
Link a social profile to a user.
Unlink a social profile from a user.

item.name: Tenant Memberships
item.description: Manage user memberships in tenants. Users can belong to multiple tenants with different roles.

request.description: Get all tenants a user belongs to, with their role in each tenant.
Get the user's default tenant (used for login context).
Set the user's default tenant. The user must be a member of this tenant.
Get all members of a tenant.
Add a user to a tenant with a specific role. The user can belong to multiple tenants.
Get a specific user's membership details in a tenant.
Update a user's role or status in a tenant.
Remove a user from a tenant.

item.name: Policy Sync Service
item.description: Policy sync service for managing role policies in DynamoDB. This service syncs roles and permissions from RDS to DynamoDB for fast authorizer lookups.

request.description: Check if the policy sync service is healthy.
Trigger a full sync of all roles from RDS to DynamoDB. This will scan all roles in RDS and update DynamoDB accordingly.
Sync a single role from RDS to DynamoDB by role ID.
Get a global role policy from DynamoDB by role name. Returns the scopes (permissions) for the role.
Get a tenant-scoped role policy from DynamoDB. If not found, returns 404 (check global policy instead).
Sync all role policies for a specific tenant from RDS to DynamoDB.

item.name: Property Service
item.description: Property listings, amenities, and media management.

item.name: Properties
item.description: Property CRUD operations.

body.raw:
{
  "title": "Luxury 3-Bedroom Apartment in Lekki",
  "description": "Beautiful modern apartment with ocean views",
  "price": 85000000,
  "category": "SALE",
  "propertyType": "APARTMENT",
  "country": "Nigeria",
  "currency": "NGN",
  "city": "Lagos",
  "district": "Lekki Phase 1",
  "streetAddress": "123 Admiralty Way",
  "nBedrooms": "3",
  "nBathrooms": "3",
  "nParkingSpots": "2",
  "area": 250
}

request.description: Create a new property listing.
List all properties.
Get a property by ID.
Update a property.
Delete a property.
Get all media (images, videos) for a property.
Get all documents for a property.
Check database connectivity.

item.name: Amenities
item.description: Property amenity management.

request.description: Create a new amenity.
List all amenities.
Get an amenity by ID.
Update an amenity.
Delete an amenity.
